TopicTitle: The MU DP-1 "Aldrin" Orbital Drop Outpost!

Articles.Content:
Many sci-fi stories feature the capability to "Drop" ships, ground vehicles, and buildings from orbit, enabling rapid building of colonies, armies, and even whole cities.

However, that might seem impossible for KSP. Until now.

Meet the DP-1 Aldrin Orbitally Dropped Outpost, courtesy of the Mechani Union's colonization department.

This state-of-the-art base/outpost is designed to be "dropped from orbit" (deployed on a sub-orbital trajectory) and land safely under its own power.

This is accomplished via a robust parachute system, plus 4 LV-T30 retrorockets.

This base comes in at just under 230,000 funds in career mode, and carry up to 24 kerbals. It's constructed out of 386 parts, and is just under 100 tons.

It's garage can hold most medium-to-small size rovers, and it can be expanded via klaw-equipped add-on modules (in development).

//ACTION GROUPS://

1- LV-T30s

2- Drogue Chutes

3- Regular Chutes

G- Open/Close Garage Doors

///FLIGHT PROFILE:///

1-Launch using heavy-lift rocket(s).

2-Haul out to your destination.

3-Use a tug (or transfer stage) to "drop" from orbit.

4- Ditch the tug and land using the parachutes and retrorockets.
